text: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

text: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
author: Winston Churchill

text: I'll prepare and someday my chance will come.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.
author: Neil Gaiman

text: Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
author: Anatole France

text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
author: Jim Rohn

text: There's power in looking silly and not caring that you do.
author: Amy Poehler

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right.
author: Henry Ford

text: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
author: Rose Kennedy

text: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: One who gains strength by overcoming obstacles possesses the only strength which can overcome adversity.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

text: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
author: Alexander the Great

text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: I will prepare and someday my chance will come.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that there was within me an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

text: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
author: Pope John XXIII

text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Confucius

text: Difficulties increase the nearer we get to the goal.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
author: Robert Schuller

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert

text: Keep your eyes on the stars and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
author: Michael Jordan

text: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
author: Og Mandino

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
author: Epictetus

text: In times of change, learners inherit the earth, while the learned find themselves beautifully equipped to deal with a world that no longer exists.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Chuck Swindoll

text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Laozi

text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
author: Bo Jackson

text: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Nobody will believe in you unless you believe in yourself.
author: Liberace

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply!
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: If you're changing the world, you're working on important things. You're excited to get up in the morning.
author: Larry Page

text: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison with it, that was the miracle.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
author: George S. Patton

text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
author: Harriet Tubman

text: Be Impeccable with Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

text: As you think, so shall you become.
author: Bruce Lee

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Quality is not an act; it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
author: Gordon Hinckley

text: If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?
author: Joe Namath

text: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Believe deep down in your heart that you're destined to do great things.
author: Joe Paterno

text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ‘Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: Jerome

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

text: I can, therefore I am.
author: Simone Weil

text: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: Do more than dream: work.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
author: Walt Disney

text: Nothing happens unless first we dream.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

text: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: The best thing in every noble dream is the dreamer...
author: Moncure D. Conway

text: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.
author: Anatole France

text: All the great performers I have worked with are fueled by a personal dream.
author: John Eliot

text: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
author: Michael Phelps

text: The poor man is not he who is without a cent, but he who is without a dream.
author: Harry Kemp

text: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
author: John Quincy Adams

text: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
author: Denis Waitley

text: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dream, and endeavors to live the life which he had imagines, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I love wisdom. And you can never be great at anything unless you love it. Not be in love with it, but love the thing, admire the thing. And it seems that if you love the thing, and you don't just want to possess it, it will find you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We may encounter many defeats, but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: All great achievements require time.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I believe that every person is born with talent.
author: Maya Angelou

text: When you learn, teach. When you get, give.
author: Maya Angelou

text: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
author: Carol Burnett

text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
